qas.question: When was the beta version of Windows 8 made available to the public?
How many things were altered after developer version release?
When was the Consumer Preview set to expire?
How many times was the Consumer Preview downloaded in the first 24 hours?
When was the beta version of Windows 9 made available to the public?
How many things were altered before developer version release?
When wasn't the Consumer Preview set to expire?
How many times was the Consumer Preview downloaded in the first 42 hours?

context: On <a0_0><b5_0>February 29, 2012<b5_0/><a0_0/>, Microsoft released Windows 8 Consumer Preview, the beta version of Windows 8, build 8250. Alongside other changes, the build removed the Start button from the taskbar for the first time since its debut on Windows 95; according to Windows manager <a1_0><b6_0>Chaitanya Sareen<b6_0/><a1_0/>, the Start button was removed to reflect their view that on Windows 8, the desktop was an "app" itself, and not the primary interface of the operating system. Windows president Steven Sinofsky said more than <a2_0><b7_0>100,000<b7_0/><a2_0/> changes had been made since the developer version went public. The day after its release, Windows 8 Consumer Preview had been downloaded <a4_0><b9_0>over one million times<b9_0/><a4_0/>. Like the Developer Preview, the Consumer Preview expired on <a3_0><b8_0>January 15, 2013<a3_0/>.
